snippet: Witnesses reported that truckloads of Rwandan soldiers recently crossed the border and were camped within 20 miles of Goma, which was captured last month and briefly occupied by rebels.
abstract: Hundreds of troops from opposing sides are moving into positions around Goma, strategic, contested city in Democratic Republic of Congo, raising worries of yet another explosion of violence.

byline.original: By JEFFREY GETTLEMAN and JOSH KRON
byline.contributor: Jeffrey Gettleman reported from Nairobi, and Josh Kron from Kampala, Uganda.

lead_paragraph: Witnesses reported that truckloads of Rwandan soldiers recently crossed the border and were camped within 20 miles of Goma, which was captured last month and briefly occupied by rebels.

headline.main: Troops Mass in Fought-Over City, Raising Fear of New Violence in Congo
headline.print_headline: Troops Mass in Fought-Over City, Raising Fear of New Violence in Congo
